PPMonth.title: Charlie and the Chocolate Factory
PPMonth.notes: Thanks to St. Louis Puzzled Pint player Matthew Stern for writing all of this month's puzzles! And thanks to Chelsea Branson for co-authoring the location puzzle!

puzzle.title: The Golden Ticket
puzzle.hint: Find the path from the golden ticket to the gates.
Every turn you make is at a junction of two streets (one numbered, one named).
Use the numbered street to index into the named street. 1st Ave + Stardust Blvd = S.
The solution is STICKY FINGERS.

puzzle.title: The Chocolate Room
puzzle.hint: Once you solve each clue, do you notice something regarding "holes", "bridges", "rivers"?
Find a path that starts at a "Start" that avoids words with holes and rivers while going over the "bridge"
The first half of the path before the bridge says "Kickstarter - Roald Dahl Book Title Adjective about James Peach" which is GIANT
Second half of the path says "Extra squares NATO Letters Vertically"

puzzle.title: The Inventing Room
puzzle.hint: Once all lines a drawn, look to the uncovered letters (i.e. no line drawn through them)
Uncovered letters spell out "HIGHLIGHT SINGLE WIRES"
Did those single lines create a shapes that might be of use or perhaps spell out something?

puzzle.title: The Nut Room
puzzle.hint: Each nut can be transformed into a new word with a ROT cipher. That new word should coorspond with the squirrel responses below.
The quanity for each price deThescribes how many squirrels use the new word
The error code is how many letters foward each word is shifted
Convert the error codes to letters (12 = L)

puzzle.title: The Television Room
puzzle.hint: Each movie description descrives a popular movie with one letter changed in its title.
The first movie is "Toy Stork"
Take the changed letter and place it in the televisions below.

puzzle.title: The Great Glass Elevator (meta puzzle)
puzzle.hint: I wonder where I can find bugs from the other puzzles?
The candies all have traits that should be familar from the other puzzles
Draw lines from the candies to the bugs. What's left?

puzzle.title: The Oompa Loompas (bonus puzzle)
puzzle.hint: Look for the candies in the testimonies
Well, you might not find the candies EXACTLY. Perhaps with an extra ingredient?
Albert's testimony contains the candy "Nerds", but with an "e" added
Take the added letter to get the solution
